intro: Banisteria campestris var. montana, commonly known as the mountain banisteria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that are typically orange or red in color. The plant has a climbing habit and produces small, elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
